Hope you find out before you buy the first time.

Review.Titre: This is identity theft from MoonPay
Review.Contenu: Has anyone experienced when verifying your account, MoonPay wants you to provide proof of income and then being told to send bank statements? I think this is absolute rubbish and also a security breach of my personal information. I sent 3 recent payslips that has all my details on there which also has my bank account number and employee number. I pretty much got stuffed around by this company. Prior to this I sent a copy of my drivers license. So it almost looks like identity theft regarding the information they are requesting. I never had this issue when I first used this platform, but just recently because I was trying to send funds to my brother to pay towards his medical bill but my account was blocked until further verification. If this was the case, why was it not addressed earlier? I have heard negative reviews about MoonPay, but at the time  I was satisfied with the service. Now that I’ve experienced all these issues, I agree with the reviews and will be sure to warn others not to use this app cause they don’t look after their clients and they’re based in the Seychelles.

As I look online I see a lot of the same complaints. We the people of the US need to get together a get a petition again these scammer and shut them down. I’m seeing that people saying that they hold money for 10 days, that’s because they are using our money to make more money. They won’t answer the phone they won’t message you back this is poor for business. I need my money today and will not ever mess with these people ever again. Please do no use these people cause they are scams. If I have to miss another day of work trying to track down my funds I will be getting a lawyer to sue these folks for all the money I’m missing trying to track down money I already have. AGAIN DONT NOT MESS WITH THESE PEOPLE IF YOU DONT WANT FOLKS TAKING YOU MONEY. Why should I pay someone to pay me money that owed to me?!

Review.Titre: Little respect for the customer - Peu de respect du client
Review.Contenu: They have an unfavorable exchange rate, and much higher fees than others. With them, you lose $27 out of 100! Is this normal?They don't seem to have much respect for their customers: They display all their first names all the time, don't respect their username, and don't have a proper settings system to deal with these issues.It's simple, the customer can't do anything by himself with everything that concerns him, except to settle coogkies and delete his account. But they keep his credit card details.For the rest, spending money is fine. The only benefit to you is what makes them money.And be careful not to get tricked: they send you an email asking for your opinion. But without telling you that your name with all your first names will be displayed. No discretion. It's serious!Also, some lies: the customer could change nothing of his personal data and their display?--Il ont un change défavorable, et des frais beaucoup plus importants que d'autres. Avec eux, vous perdez 27 $ sur 100 ! Est-ce normal ? Ils semblent ne pas avoir beaucoup de respect pour leurs clients : Ils affichent à chaque fois tous ses prénoms, ne respectent pas son nom d'usage, et n'ont pas un système correcte de paramètres pour régler ces questions. C'est simple, le client ne peut rien faire par lui-même de tout ce qui le concerne, à part de régler les cookies et supprimer son compte. Mais ils gardent les données de sa carte de crédit. Pour le reste, dépenser de l'argent, ça va. Le seul avantage pour vous est ce qui leur rapporte comme argent à eux. Et faites attention à ne pas vous faire piéger: ils vous envoient un courriel pour vous demander votre avis. Mais sans vous dire que votre nom avec tous vos prénoms sera affiché. Aucune discrétion. C'est grave! Aussi, quelques mensonges : le client ne pourrait rien changer de ses données personnelles et leur affichage ?
